Question: Which of the following is a garbage collection algorithm that divides the heap into two spaces: Young and Old?
What is the primary advantage of the Generational Garbage Collection approach?
OptionA: Most objects have short lifetimes, allowing for quick collection in the Young generation
OptionB: It works well for large heaps with few short-lived objects
OptionC: It eliminates the need for garbage collection roots
OptionD: It provides better performance for long-lived objects in the Old generation
CorrectAnswer: Most objects have short lifetimes, allowing for quick collection in the Young generation

Question: What is the role of the Young generation" in Generational Garbage Collection?"
OptionA: It is the area where new objects are allocated, and most short-lived objects are collected here
OptionB: It is the oldest generation, storing long-lived objects
OptionC: It is a reserved space for garbage collection roots
OptionD: It is the region where objects are marked and compacted
CorrectAnswer: It is the area where new objects are allocated, and most short-lived objects are collected here

Question: What happens during the Minor Garbage Collection" phase in the Generational Garbage Collection approach?"
OptionA: It collects short-lived objects in the Young generation
OptionB: It collects long-lived objects in the Old generation
OptionC: It marks and compacts objects in the heap
OptionD: It frees up memory reserved for garbage collection roots
CorrectAnswer: It collects short-lived objects in the Young generation

Question: When does the Major Garbage Collection" phase occur in Generational Garbage Collection?"
OptionA: When the Old generation becomes full
OptionB: When the Young generation becomes empty
OptionC: When there is a memory leak in the heap
OptionD: When all objects are marked as collectable
CorrectAnswer: When the Old generation becomes full

Question: What is the purpose of the Old generation" in Generational Garbage Collection?"
OptionA: It is the area where long-lived objects are promoted after surviving multiple Minor Garbage Collections
OptionB: It is the youngest generation, storing newly allocated objects
OptionC: It is reserved for garbage collection roots
OptionD: It is the region where objects are marked and compacted
CorrectAnswer: It is the area where long-lived objects are promoted after surviving multiple Minor Garbage Collections

Question: What is the purpose of the Finalization" process in Garbage Collection?"
OptionA: Executing cleanup code before an object is collected
OptionC: Optimizing the execution speed of the application
